title: China Construction Bank Q4 profit rises 9 pct
text: March 27, 2018 / 12:33 PM / Updated an hour ago China Construction Bank Q4 profit rises 9 pct Reuters Staff 1 Min Read SHANGHAI/BEIJING, March 27 (Reuters) - China Construction Bank Corp (CCB), the country’s second-biggest lender by assets, on Tuesday reported a 9 percent rise in fourth-quarter profit, beating analyst estimates. Net profit for October-December rose to 41.02 billion yuan ($6.53 billion), versus 37.63 billion yuan a year earlier, according to Thomson Reuters calculations based on the company’s annual figures, and was above the 39.64 billion yuan average estimate from 19 analysts polled by Thomson Reuters. Full-year net profit rose 4.7 percent to 242.264 billion yuan, versus 231.46 billion yuan in 2016. CCB’s non-performing loan ratio eased to 1.49 percent at end-2017 from 1.5 percent at end-September $1 = 6.2750 Chinese yuan renminbi Reporting by Engen Tham in Shanghai and Shu Zhang in Beijing; Editing by Himani Sarkar and Louise Heavens
